decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly assembling mana sources and land drops to ramp into big threats like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift. The key strategy is to utilize Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and generate extra mana, while also using bounce lands to activate multiple land drops in a turn. The deck aims to find and use powerful lands like Urza's Saga, Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Boseiju, Who Endures to support its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with big threats and game-ending plays.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive creatures with powerful abilities to control the board and disrupt your opponent's game plan. By combining removal spells like Fatal Push and Prismatic Ending with disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Relic of Progenitus, you can clear the way for your creatures to deal damage quickly. Cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp allow you to protect your creatures and generate additional value. Overall, the deck aims to pressure your opponent early and maintain tempo throughout the game to secure victory.

The deck revolves around assembling a combo using Grinding Station, Mishra's Bauble, Mox Opal, Mox Amber, and Underworld Breach to continuously loop through your graveyard and deck, generating infinite mana and mill your opponent's library. Emry, Lurker of the Loch helps to recur artifacts and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student digs for combo pieces. Malevolent Rumble acts as a win condition, while the rest of the deck includes disruption and card draw spells to protect the combo. Urza's Saga and Thassa's Oracle provide additional utility and ways to win the game.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of powerful creatures and spells to disrupt your opponent's strategies and control the board while setting up for a game-winning combo using Goblin Charbelcher. By generating card advantage with cards like Thundertrap Trainer and Tameshi, Reality Architect, and utilizing counter spells like Pact of Negation and Disrupting Shoal, the deck can effectively stall the game until it can assemble the combo pieces needed to win. The landless aspect of the deck allows for a more streamlined and consistent game plan.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By using cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Relic of Progenitus, you can disrupt your opponent's hand, board state, and graveyard. Meanwhile, aggressive creatures like Solitude, Ketramose, and Overlord of the Balemurk can quickly close out the game. The deck also includes value cards like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate to generate additional advantage. By efficiently disrupting your opponent and applying pressure, you can outpace and overwhelm them to secure victory.

The deck focuses on using ramp spells like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to quickly generate massive amounts of mana and cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It also utilizes control elements such as Kozilek's Command and Kozilek's Return to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its powerful threats while using its control elements to protect its own game plan and deal with opposing threats.

This deck focuses on creating a powerful combo with Broodscale Bloodchief by using cards like Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker to pump up its abilities. It also includes ways to search for key pieces like Kozilek's Command and Ancient Stirrings, as well as mana acceleration with Eldrazi Temple and Urza's Saga. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Malevolent Rumble and Emrakul, the Promised End. With a mix of creatures, artifacts, and spells, this deck is designed to be fast and versatile in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This Modern deck focuses on ramping into powerful Eldrazi creatures while controlling the opponent's board with spells like Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Return. The deck utilizes mana acceleration cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to quickly cast threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility and disruption. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with large creatures and disruptive spells, while utilizing Eldrazi synergy to generate advantage and close out the game.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emperor of Bones, then bringing them back to the battlefield with Goryo's Vengeance for a game-winning combo. Atraxa, Grand Unifier helps to protect your creatures and disrupt your opponent's game plan. Consign to Memory and Faithless Looting provide card draw and graveyard filling, while Thoughtseize helps to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push to deal with threats. This instant reanimator combo deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures early in the game.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with low-cost aggressive creatures and burn spells. By playing efficient threats like Guide of Souls and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, alongside disruptive cards like Ranger-Captain of Eos and Static Prison, the goal is to apply pressure early and keep the opponent on the back foot. Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury can quickly close out games if left unchecked, while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides additional burn and creature removal. The mana base is streamlined for consistency and the sideboard likely contains additional answers for specific matchups.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly using cards like Ruby Medallion and rituals, with the goal of casting Past in Flames to recast all the spells in your graveyard. This allows you to chain spells together for a big combo turn, using Ral, Monsoon Mage as a finisher. The deck also includes cards like Questing Druid and Glimpse the Impossible to help dig through your deck and find the pieces you need to go off.
